Surgeries (one of the hospitals biggest money makers) cannot run without the CSS department yet the salaries are mediocre at best, and there are no raises besides the annual cost of living raise. Men highly favored in CSS department. Weekends/on-call mandatory since they cannot hire, train or retain a weekend crew.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Iowa City, IA
pros: Because of the Union, we have a small amount of job protection left
cons:
You have to plan on arriving early to catch the cambus if you want to be on time. Add an extra hour to your commute time!

Although you earn 1 sick day a month, you're only allowed to be sick 1 day every 3 months. Basically you're given a benefit that you'll get dinged for using. 

When the contract was gutted in 2017, the state threw out pretty much everything that would have benefitted the employees. I've been receiving the same pay as a NEWLY hired employee for about 4 years now! Basically, there is no incentive to go above and beyond! 

Although the pay has not increased, the work load sure has!

job_title: Research Assistant/Data Manager in Iowa City, IA
pros: Good work-life balance as I am usually able to take off when needed for vacation or sick time. Great research facilities with some of the best doctors around.
cons: Parking is terrible for employees and patients and can cost an arm and a leg the closer you get to the hospital. Wait lists are riduculous for certain lots and if you're not a doctor or "high-up" you don't move very much on these wait lists. It took over 3 years to be offered a spot in Finkbine and at that rate will probably take about 10 years + to be offered a spot at Kinnick. There is no opportunity to move up or get a raise as everything is extremely structured and the amount of paperwork to be done to get a simple raise is outrageous. I've been waiting almost 6 months now to have paperwork filled out for a raise/status change to even qualify me for a raise. Once the paperwork is filled out, it still has to go in front of a hospital board for approval, so no gurantees there. I've also noticed a lot of departments/personnel only care about degrees and not experience. And, if you're not a nurse or medical professional, the only extra training you will receive is what you seek out for yourself.

job_title: Clinical Support Specialist in Iowa City, IA

cons: Low Wages to offset great benefits.

job_title: Pharmacy Resident in Iowa City, IA

job_title: Nursing Assistant in Iowa City, IA
pros: Great environment and institution to work at.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) in Coralville, IA
pros: Great benefits and multiple locations.

job_title: Surgical Technologist in Iowa City, IA
pros: Complex cases. Initial starting pay is good.
cons: Taking care of patients can be an arduous task given that everything at the U moves so slowly.  The state government has also seen fit to do away with our raises and absolutely astounding health insurance that we used to have. They completely gutted our state employee union and the change in managements treatment of employees immediately went south as soon as it happened. Thankfully working at the U the hospital itself offers some health insurance to cover you but it's over 10x as expensive as what we had and is worse in coverage.  If you want to go to a job where you get zero raises, are frustrated daily by the complete lack of efficiency at every level of the hospital, and dont mind management treating you however they please then this place is for you! There are reasons that the University Hospital has such an incredibly high turnover rate. Also, if you are not a nurse then management REALLY doesn't care about you. They throw absolutely obscene amounts of money at the nurses and dont offer any other staff any incentives whatsoever. If you want career advancement this is going to be the wrong place too.

review_title: Good pay, but just looking for a warm body
job_title: Social Worker III in Iowa City, IA
pros: Good pay and good benefits for a human service provider. The medical environment is exciting and touches many people. It's also nice to have all the amenities of the hospital environment.
cons: The profession of social work is valued in the hospital, but only within a narrow window of what a social worker is qualified to do. I was recently asked if I celebrate administrative professional days which would be the skill set that is valued within the hospital. There is very little emphasis placed training or expertise and instead the focus is on finding "warm bodies" to do the work that is needing to be done. If this is why you got a masters degree, great! Then this is the spot for you. If you have any aspirations to do clinical work or be more than a glorified, well spoken secretary sent into all the hospital's most challenging situations, it may be a good idea to continue your search.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Iowa City, IA
pros: Just have to say the 1st part of my employment was great really was a team!! I felt that I could retire here! Always felt that our supervisor would stand up for us along with the head of Clinic Administration. Now clinic administration and other parts of the university who are supposed to step in when things get bad, and be there to help you and actually stand behind or at least next the employee, even when they as in (clinic Administration and Supervisors) know when something is going on and it not right or just complete “Harassment “and they choose to sweep it under the rug because of the other party being higher raking than the other employee, well something is just not right.  And you wonder why patients do not want to come here because they know and see how the employee are being treated by the staff.
cons: No longer have any!!! Lost them, I guess I would have to say my patients they keep me going.

review_title: Great Place for a long term Career
job_title: Human Resources Specialist in Muscatine, IA
pros:
I have been working at the University of Iowa Hospitals and Clinics for over 7 years now. I started in a student capacity and was able to get a full time position after graduating. 
I love the networking abilities and the wide range of individuals I get to work with daily. 
Although I do not have patient contact, I know the work that I do helps all patients, families, employees, and visitors. 
The pay and benefits are also an additional perk.
cons: With being such a large institution communication can get lost. I just think it is very important to use as many different methods of communication as possible; email, phone calls, flyers, reminders, etc.

job_title: Central Sterilization in Iowa City, IA
pros:
Large variety of work to do (if they let you do multiple things)
Benefits as of the union being there are great.
cons:
Management is bad. More concerned with numbers looking good than their staff.
Given 12 hours of sick time a month, only allowed to use 16.5 hours per rolling 3 month period without disciplinary action. (Doesn't matter if kids wife or you are sick no excuse is allowed, only FMLA papers which cannot be acquired until after the 1 year mark.

Job duties fall under favoritism.  Some employees spend the majority of the time in the easier areas where the same hand full of people are stuck doing the hard work.

job_title: Support Services Specialist in Iowa City, IA
pros: Great Benefits. Good time off. Lots of different career choices all within one area. Great ability to grow in your career.
cons: Hard to get in. The time from application to interview/hire is way too long. Many great people are lost simply because they take jobs at places that do not take as long through the process. Not uncommon to have a couple months pass in the whole application/interview/hire process.

job_title: Medical Receptionist in Iowa City, IA
pros: Good pay - $16.48 for a medical receptionist position. No experience needed to land the job - ideal position for a recent college graduate.
cons: Dishonest management. My training group was hired as full time. We were scheduled for 40 hours during the first week, and our hours were subsequently cut down to 32 per week. Employees exhibited negative attitudes, condescension, and a love for gossip. Even management would tear down other department managers and employees, often engaging in viscous gossip with the employees under their leadership. You need a strong mentality to survive here. Turnover in the receptionist department is through the roof, and most are fighting tooth and nail to protect their job security. Training consisted of silly teamwork exercises with little focus on what employees needed to know to accurately make appointments for patients.

job_title: Marketing Communications Intern in Iowa City, IA
pros: The people you work with have so many different areas of expertise and can help you grow in any way you choose. There is room for growth, but you have to make sure to ask for it sometimes.
cons: You can get stuck in a rut that is unproductive if you aren't careful. Those who oversee you can sometimes forget you need to be actively working on something different or invigorating once in awhile.

review_title: Great salary, amazing benefits, and you can stay forever!
job_title: Middle Management in Iowa City, IA
pros: The benefits are outstanding - cheap insurance subsidized by UI, awesome retirement match and extraordinary wellness programs. Annual reviews that really happen. Exceptional amounts of time off. Nice people. Since there is so little structure and leadership, most jobs can be what you make them.
cons: Weird little silos, and job functions fractured to suit admin personalities rather than strategy or logic. Parking is horrible - 15-year minimum waiting list. YOU CAN'T FIRE ANYBODY: employees drinking on the job, asleep on the job, showing up only 3% of the time? Your good workers will just have to pick up the slack (without overtime) as HR tries to avoid any hint of a lawsuit by providing continuous accommodations. Every department has deadwood and legacies that have been there 30+ years and stopped working 20 years ago. Surprisingly little structure - no one knows what anyone else is doing, so there's a lot of repetition of effort and whole chunks of things that everyone assumes someone else must be addressing. (They're not.) Onboarding is really poor - you get a morning of "orientation" that's really just a benefits explanation and a quick tour. Find a friend that knows things, and do it fast, or you will be lost for a long time.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Iowa City, IA
pros: They have many open spots for current students and do not require you to work a grueling amount of hours on top of your class schedule. Pays well to the poor college students compared to everything else around the town paying at minimum wage. Schedules are set for the entire semester so you never need to know when you are working that week. Can easily get a scheduling change as long as it is a week before that change.
cons: Student supervisors write you up if you are only a few minutes late, even if it was just after an exam or something of that nature.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Iowa City, IA
pros: Benefits are great! That's where it ends.
cons: There is NO room for advancement. RNs tend to treat you poorly. There is no support from management. It's a do your job and shut up atmosphere. I have worked in 3 different areas over 12 years and it's all the same. Resident physicians can be rough to work for, as they feel they have to exude authority when they have no clue what they are doing. I personally have saved several from law suit type mistakes. Faculty physicians tend to be great.

job_title: Support Services Specialist in Coralville, IA
pros: Great Pay. Friendly coworkers. They do a pretty good job of hiring. Nice building. Very flexible with all employees work schedules, whether you are a parent or a student or have multiple jobs! Great place to start.
cons: Not much room for growth. Very different then other places I've worked where you move quickly and learn lots. University expects you to move very slowly through training and the learning process. Very Political.

job_title: Frontline Clinic Coordinator/Lead Medical Assistant in Tipton, IA
pros: good support from management depending on the department you work for. Other departments only hold you down. Good training to help you take the next step if you have management support.
cons: no support from HR or the Union. They only hold you back which is why this is a good stepping stone and not a good career.

review_title: Overnight work can be very rewarding, but not much feedback from management staff.
job_title: Psychiatry Nursing Assistant in Iowa City, IA
pros: Great benefits, willing to work with school schedule, and change hours after you've completed 6 month orientation. Rewarding to work with patients and coworkers.
cons: As a overnight worker never saw my manager, when I got my 6 month review, I only had one feedback comment, which was positive and was given by a very nice nurse. Otherwise, if someone hadn't liked me, they could have submitted feedback. So not very balanced review of the quality of my work.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Iowa City, IA
pros: Great diverse group of people, benefits were really great.  Vacation policy was very generous, job duties were clearly outlined and expectations were clear.  Pay was good.
cons: Too many levels of management, most without many answers to questions.  I worked in the food department for the patients, and the food wasn't good quality, so I felt bad sending it to patients.

job_title: Communications Infrastructure Engineer in Iowa City, IA
pros: Eddie Etsey is a fantastic human being.  He is the best manager I've ever had.  Great benefits.
cons: Departments fight with each other and pass blame constantly instead of actually tackling issues like adults.

job_title: Research Assistant in Iowa City, IA
pros: Typical large hospital environment with generally nice people. Can be a confusing place to navigate and many parts of the hospital are quite old. However they are constantly building and expanding not only on the structure but the general environment of the hospital as a whole. Its situated in a small town obviously but there are still plenty of things to do and a very friendly midwest environment will greet you. Perk-access to the university rec center.
cons: Confusing to navigate, over priced food, and horrible elevators!

job_title: Revenue Cycle Representative in Iowa City, IA
pros: Very easy to learn in this environment, able to work from home after 6 months and most are very willing to help new employees.
cons: Not much room for growth, many representatives looking to move up in the organization but there are not too many opportunities. Not much incentive to work above a fairly easy standard.

review_title: I has been great worked with lots of good people. I am only a student so my opportunities and  skill building was limite
job_title: Student Clerk in Iowa City, IA
pros:
Great people that understand class schedules and flexibility.
Good managers that understand what needs as a student are.
Decent pay for a student.
cons:
Compensation seems low for the amount of things I do.
There are no benefits for students, and training was very small had to learn everything on my own.

job_title: Patient Account Representative in Iowa City, IA
pros: Lots of opportunities for advancement. Good pay and great benefits. Most employees are very professional. Good working environment throughout, employees voices are heard and respected.
cons: Large organization, too much administration/high ranked individuals making decisions for the rest of us when they don't know how they will affect the actual workers.

job_title: in Iowa City, IA
pros: healthcare benefits are wonderful if you like only being able to go to the university
cons:
no room for career growth
additional training not provided
unreasonable expectations
supervisors with quick temper
supervisors with tenure and early onset dementia 
salary is not commensurate to level of employment
unreasonable educational achievement in comparison to pay for example they only want to pay $40K for a person with a MBA.

job_title: IT Support Technician in Iowa City, IA
pros: The University has a great benefits package and generous time off available to use.  It should be an easy place to advance but...
cons: ...its not.  Once you get into a position it is hard to advance further within that position.  Plus there is always the fear of budget cuts.

job_title: Clinical Trials Research Associate in Iowa City, IA
pros: Fantastic place to work. I love my department and my team. I highly recommend UIHC to anyone. Lots of opportunity. Fantastic benefits.
cons: There is little outdoor/employee space to enjoy. Most people complain about the commute/parking issue, which is probably the biggest downfall.

review_title: Bad management allowed to fester, continue
job_title: Creative Media Specialist in Iowa City, IA
pros: Great benefits, decent pay, and excellent leave policies if you wind up working under a good manager
cons: This is an organization that has a lot of layers, but does not do a good job of retaining talent or identifying poor management and intervening. I have personally watched a lot of retaliation and poor management performance fester and lead to employee exits that could have easily been avoided by proper follow-up from HR or higher levels of leadership.

review_title: Great Student Job at the U of I
job_title: Student Computer Technician in Iowa City, IA
pros: Flexible hours, good pay for work load. If you are really into computers or networks this is a good starting point. People are generally very easy to work with. Sometimes you get cool projects
cons: During some months it can be a lot of busy work, and even still you'll still be looking to kill time. If you don't like computers this would not be a good fit.

review_title: Most supportive place for junior faculty
job_title: House Staff in Iowa City, IA
pros: Down to earth and incredibly smart staff
cons: Location is not best if interested in big city life

job_title: Central Sterilization Technician in Iowa City, IA
pros: Top notch facilities and the people who work there are incredible. If I come back to Iowa I will be working there again.
cons: You would be hard pressed to find someone who didn't like working at the U. There is a reason they are top ranked every year and it is the culture of being exceptional.

job_title: in Cedar Rapids, IA
pros: Excellent Benefits, Great Stability, Lots of resources for Nurses
cons:
Employee Parking
Day/Night Rotation
Very High Acuity & High Stress Environment
Staffing shortages/issues, especially a lack of aides and support staff
Very Large facility where you may feel lost in the shuffle, or like a number

review_title: Awesome benefits begets lots of lazy employees
job_title: Compliance Coordinator in Iowa City, IA
pros: Great medical insurance, dental and retirement is unmatched by many other employers nationally.
cons: Good benefits causes lazy employees. Lots of people working there just for the benefits. Can be hard to advance. Old hospital area leaves a lot to be desired. Some management seems incompetent.

review_title: Satisfying and fulfilling place to work, allows for networking and meeting many wonderful people.
job_title: Customer Support Analyst in Iowa City, IA
pros: Friendly staff, great work atmosphere, patients/customers help to make each day special and eventful, plenty of challenges to keep motivated. Near impossible to come to work without a smile.
cons: Commuting to and from work may become tedious at times - having to pay for parking all the time and walking yet, or relying upon a bus schedule

review_title: Management is based on MSN, not ability to manage people.
job_title: Acute Dialysis BSN in Iowa City, IA
pros: Fun fast work place with young people in the learning phase of their careers.  Great compensation and benefits.
cons: Management.    Probation period for nurses ridiculously long, 9 months???

job_title: Hospital Security Officer in Iowa City, IA
pros: University benefits are the best in the state. Department was very good to work for, job not too difficult and everyday is a little different.
cons: Shift work can suck. Essential position so you work holidays. Dept is always short staffed which leads to lots of mandatory overtime but the paychecks are nice.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Iowa City, IA
pros: The benefits of UIHC are great! The basic salary is okay but good for living in Iowa. Co-workers are nice! The HR department is very accessible as well.
cons: Workload sometimes can be heavy, but teamwork is good in UIHC!

review_title: Supportive environment encouraging innovation at every level.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Iowa City, IA
pros:
-Culture fosters innovation.
-Incredibly bright and talented co-workers.
-Opportunity for advancement.
cons:
-The official management structure is slightly misguided.
-In 1.5 years of working there, I have not received a pay raise (even though promised).

job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Iowa City, IA
pros: Many opportunities to change positions while still working for the hospital. Higher pay than many other hospitals in Iowa and Illinois. guaranteed raise for merit employees after first year.
cons: Must pay for parking, can be a hassle. And there is always construction going on. Watch out for parking tickets...they will catch you if you park in the wrong place.

job_title: Emergency Room Nursing Assistant in Iowa City, IA
pros: Co-Workers are willing to help and are very understanding. The managers actually do their job and they lead by doing. The job is never boring because their is always something to do.
cons: The hours. 10 hour shifts are brutal if you are not used to them. For the job that you have to do it is a bit underpaid.

job_title: Research Assistant in Iowa City, IA
pros: great benefits. engaging workplace, if personally driven.
cons: little room for promotion.  salary is only marginally better than new people entering the position, even after many years in the position and despite good reviews.

job_title: Administrative Services Coordinator in Iowa City, IA
pros: Benefits are great. 100% healthcare coverage, flex spending account, 3+ weeks of vacation every year. Depending on your department, some flexibility to work at home.
cons: Administration takes very little into consideration. Takes forever for new programs and staff to be approved. HR always slow, not always responsive.

job_title: Storekeeper II in Iowa City, IA
pros: Working in the storeroom was nice. They were flexible with scheduling and my co workers were very nice. It is also a relaxed work environment.
cons: There weren't too many cons about working in the storeroom. There is a lot of walking, and it is easy to make a mistake by picking the wrong product. Besides that there aren't any issues.

job_title: Patient Escort in Iowa City, IA
pros: A lot of students work as patient escorts! They are fun and the middle aged women are very nice if you talk to them. It's fun talking to patients and knowing your whole way around the hospital.
cons: The older woman are very picky about being on your phone and always looking for wheelchairs. Avoid them if possible when working

review_title: I found the people helpful and friendly. Good working relationships. UIHC works like a team - focus is on the patients.
job_title: Secretary in Iowa City, IA
pros: Really good benefits. Health insurance for my family and they do offer many training opportunities.
cons: Parking is difficult mainly because UIHC is growing. It is a temporary setback - otherwise, a wonderful place to work.

job_title: Patient Escort in Iowa City, IA
pros: A student job that was flexible and let you set your own hours was great. The permanent staff understood if you needed work off because of a test or any complication like that. Also a pretty relaxed work environment.
cons: Sometimes working with patients you can get a little more than you bargain for.

review_title: Excellent Benefit Package, and supportive of family work bablance in most departments
job_title: Administrative Specialist in Iowa City, IA
pros: Benefits: approx $250 per month for family coverage for health and dental AND 5 weeks of vacation to start at the Proffesional and Scientific level
cons: Union Environment makes some things difficult to achieve

review_title: amazing benefits, not so amazing culture
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Iowa City, IA
pros: Decent salary with 401K DOUBLE match, great medical/dental, 4.8 weeks of vacation, 3.6 weeks sick.
cons: Change of any kind is difficult, leaders are not effective, lots of waste

job_title: Student Clerk in Iowa City, IA
pros:
- Very flexible scheduling
- Great environment to work in due to the new facility in North Liberty yet having a local location in Iowa City.
cons: lack of communication due to the separation of full time staff and students/part-time staff.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Iowa City, IA
pros: The people at this institution are great! They are incredibly helpful and caring. There is no comparison in the state.
cons: Only cons to working here are that it is in a smaller city. Iowa City is growing every year and it is a college town, but it is on the smaller side.

job_title: Nursing Unit Clerk in Iowa City, IA
pros: The benefits are great and there is a lot of potential to move around and try other jobs within the hospital
cons: Getting a job there can take more than a year and once you are in do not plan on leaving or you will never get in again.

review_title: Dependable long-term job but too much red tape
job_title: Applications Developer in Iowa City, IA
pros: Good benefits, long-term employment, and decent working condition
cons: Inconsistent workload, lots of management changes, unengaged supervisors and employees generally do the bare minimum to keep their job

job_title: Imaging Technologist in Iowa City, IA
pros: Excellent benefits.  Outstanding retirement plan as well as sick leave and paid time off.  Very nice hospital.  Modern technology in the hospital.
cons: It is an educational hospital so you have to be okay with teaching students and be patient to have a job here.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Iowa City, IA
pros: Cutting edge tech,  nationally ranked (some departments)
cons: No raises for Merit union staff members who are already below market pay, unhappy work environment, parking is inconvenient and expensive,  little to no beds for new patients - over crowding which impacts patient care, advancement opportunities are limited.

job_title: Lab Tech in Iowa City, IA
pros:
Complete and absolute job security. There is literally nothing I could do to loose this job. 
Benefits are second to none anywhere.
cons:
No room for advancement
Little to room to learn and advance your knowledge/experience/career
Bloated, inefficient staffing "top heavy"
Co-workers are mostly sheep

job_title: Certified Coder in Iowa City, IA
pros: Benefits are the only pro to working at the U of Iowa
cons: The U is not employee friendly.  The manager of our department treated us like crap! The u makes coders take their made tests in order to keep your job. All pay less than medirevv. after being picked on by our department manager so much I quit and went to medirevv. I love it there!

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Iowa City, IA
pros: flexible hours, lots of variety, good pay and benefits 50% or higher
cons: If you are employed as a temporary position, you get really flexile hours however no benefits. It's also hard to trade hours because in the float pool there is no primary unit

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Iowa City, IA
pros: Excellent home/work balance.  Seldom did after hours or weekends.
cons: Low pay.  The exceptional benefits were being cut when I left.

job_title: Psychiatry Nursing Assistant in Iowa City, IA
pros: Good benefit, good people working around, my manager is very nice person, good entry level job because you will learn a lot.
cons: People gossip all the time, some of the nurses are not that friendly, salary is slightly low

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Iowa City, IA
pros: Great staff to work with
cons: Difficulty with management when trying to help each family or patient in a different way--Each pt or family is different, and so "scripting" does not always work

review_title: Great place to start a career
job_title: Administrative in Iowa City, IA
pros: Plenty of room for growth, great pay for entry level. Great environment with lots of variety day to day.
cons: So much bureaucracy and red tape. It takes a lot for someone incompetent to be fired.

job_title: Student Programmer in Iowa City, IA
pros: Flexible hours around school, a lot of good experience with programming.
cons: There was not anything bad about working there. All of the other programmers were very helpful.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Iowa City, IA
pros: benefits, flexibility in scheduling, opportunities for overtime, some specialties nationally ranked, teaching institution
cons: salary, nurse to patient ratio on some units, middle management seems pressured to please upper management rather than support nursing staff

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Iowa City, IA
pros: Good work environment, opportunity to learn a lot.
cons: very busy, sicker patients, high work load volume due to increased patient census. Hourly wage is very low.

job_title: Food Worker in Iowa City, IA
pros: great hours good people to work with.
cons: Hours is not that flexible and parking is not that good specially when there is a football game its hard to find a pales to park for employs.

job_title: Manager in Iowa City, IA
pros: Super benefits, great 401k, along with insurance package.
cons: Like anywhere with unions; there may be times an employee that should be let go- isn't .

job_title: Student Project Manager in Iowa City, IA
pros: Hours, flexibility, full time in summer, boss was amazing
cons: Lack of communication, upper management was trash, used scare tactics, not organized what so ever, pay was garbage even for a student job.

review_title: Professional team but unexpected waiting time
job_title: Hospital Interpreter in Iowa City, IA
pros: A friendly working environment with a professional team
cons: The waiting time in the hospital can be really long in some departments

job_title: Student Clerk in Coralville, IA
pros: My supervisor has been very flexible with my schedule.  He looks to accomodate student workers and find the right hours to fulfill employment.
cons: Overstaffing at times- makes for a slow day.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Iowa City, IA
pros: Great benefits and educational opportunities. I really grew as a nurse at this facility.
cons: Staffing shortages, heavy patient care work loads.

job_title: Accounting Assistant in Le Claire, IA
pros: I really liked working in the psychiatry department, as a student.  The other two accountants were always very helpful.
cons: The position was work study, so it ended when I graduated.

job_title: Revenue Cycle Analyst in Iowa City, IA
pros: Good company to work for.  Great benefits, adverage pay, friendley atmosphere and everyone is professional.
cons: Not many opportunities for advancement in the department I worked in.

review_title: Amazing company to work for and great insurance.
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Iowa City, IA
pros: Great insurance , great doctors , and there is always someone to help you .
cons: The parking for staff is not that good.

review_title: Not as great as it once was
job_title: Staff Nurse in Iowa City, IA
pros: Benefits and starting wages are high for the area.
cons: No contract.  Rules are not clearly defined.

job_title: Staff Nurse in Iowa City, IA
pros:
Great pride is taken in the care we give.
Nurses are supported by a union.
cons: pay is just barely comparable to the rest of the nation.

review_title: Excellent learning experience with immense potential for top-notch healthcare career preparation.
job_title: Research Assistant in Iowa City, IA
pros:
Quality of MD's and PhD's.
Cutting edge research and facilities, brand new research buildings.
cons:
Limited growth potential

That's about it!

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Iowa City, IA
pros: Each department has its own culture, but I love my job.
cons: I understand some departments are in disarray.

job_title: Student Programmer in Iowa City, IA
pros: As a part time job, the schedule is  flexible with good pay
cons: Not too much cons because this position is pretty good for a student

job_title: IT Support Consultant in Iowa City, IA
pros: Excellent place to work. Great co-workers and work environment. Benefits are great.
cons: I commuted so the drive plus work shift was 13 - 15 hours.

job_title: Software Developer in Iowa City, IA
pros: Great benefits and nobody expects you to work over the weekend
cons: A culture of not wanting to do anything wrong suffocates any possible growth or innovation.

job_title: Student Office Assistant/Clerk in Iowa City, IA
pros: Great flexibility with working hours around student courses/studying/activities.
cons: Only that you are at the bottom of the totem pole so to speak.

job_title: Unit Clerk in Iowa City, IA
pros: benfits co-workers vacation pay lots of opportunity to move up
cons: Managers should be more hands on.

job_title: in Iowa City, IA
pros: Great benefits, paid time off, sick time, flexible schedule

review_title: Amazing place to work for as a student!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Iowa City, IA
pros: Flexible shift, great management and a best of all great pay.

job_title: Food Service Worker in Iowa City, IA
pros: Great pay for a part time job. Worked in the cafateria. They offer great benefits.

job_title: in Iowa City, IA
pros: Great work environment, positive management involvement, supportive co-workers.
cons: I haven't experienced any cons.

job_title: in Marshalltown, IA
pros: UIHC offers a great working environment, awesome support from management, and positive job opportunitiesl
cons: There aren't any cons that I've experienced.

review_title: Fine place to work, but don't stay too long
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Iowa City, IA
pros: Fair benefits, Most of the people are really good

review_title: Poor management and lack of officer support
job_title: Hospital Security Officer in Iowa City, IA

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Iowa City, IA

job_title: Caterer in Iowa City, IA

review_title: Launched my IT career as a college student
job_title: Computer Programmer/I T Consultant in Iowa City, IA

review_title: Great career opportunities and once in a lifetime experiences

Generous employee benefits
Reimbursement for continuing education

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Iowa City, IA

job_title: Clinical Trials Research Associate in Iowa City, IA

job_title: Clinical Lab Scientist in Iowa City, IA

pros: Fulfilling work, great people, great mission, great facilities.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Iowa City, IA
pros: My immediate supervisor was excellent. Fair, good coach.

job_title: in Brooklyn, IA
pros: Friendly environment, good pay and benefits. All around good experience.

job_title: in Kansas City, MO
pros: Great opportunity with good pay

job_title: Student Office Assistant in Iowa City, IA

job_title: STaff Registered Nurse in Iowa City, IA

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Iowa City, IA

Fun and exciting experience
Great job during college

job_title: Nursing Assistant in Iowa City, IA

job_title: Nursing Assistant in Iowa City, IA

Good people
